official_title: A bill to amend title 39, United States Code, to provide that the use of a 9-digit ZIP code system (or any system of more than 5 digits) be voluntary.

summary.text: Prohibits the United States Postal Service from conditioning the acceptance or delivery of, or level of service for, mail on the use of any ZIP code of more than five digits. Allows the Postal Service to establish different postage rates for mail bearing such a ZIP code.

titles.title: A bill to amend title 39, United States Code, to provide that the use of a 9-digit ZIP code system (or any system of more than 5 digits) be voluntary.
